Description of incident: An employee emailed spreadsheets with sensitive patient information to a personal account in order to work from home.  Names, ages, dates of service, diagnoses, and medical record numbers were in the spreadsheets.  The breach was discovered on August 8 and initially suspected to have been caused by a computer intrusion.  Hospice of the Chesapeake investigated the breach for two months before revealing it to patients.UPDATE (11/08/2013): Hospice of the Chesapeake notified HHS and stated that 7,035 patients were affected.
